document.title: Ohio's Learning Standards World Languages and Cultures Novice Level (K-6)

A6EA541F79144FEE8E00F82242F03481.description: Give simple facts or details about a landmark or place visited.

354B02BA7E134A2BB83386DAE9ACDDB7.description: Express how to prepare a food or follow a simple routine.

0988B10073AF45DEB739534F3CE377F8.description: Make plans with a peer about where to go and when to meet.

7D9555BFEC6F464B993E0D727C2A9A18.description: Ask for and give simple directions to a location.

37DF16AB247242ED8EE4F40F26BD51F1.description: Ask and answer simple questions about dates, times, places and events on posters or tickets.

DF80781A00C048A9998E9934BC53D0B7.description: Understand a simple transaction between a customer and clerk.

A1CF0EDB31EB4A2CBF1C84B444E03037.description: Follow a simple math problem with figures.

2BFE186F4D4F49D1AC95B66BFFB1CE99.description: Recognize the difference between a question and statement about age, activities or family.

F01D7025B578408193F5E8F0F25A2784.description:
Identify similarities and differences in simple cultural products and practices to help understand perspectives in native and Deaf cultures, such as:
  • Regional differences in languages;
  • Storytelling traditions;
  • Use of technology to communicate.

1D3177DEF6CA4584ACC789AF9BB708F5.description: Sign simple information based on photos of animals, historical figures or sports.

22D373B213ED496296DF9DF35F7B5BA7.description: Sign daily schedule of activities with times.

6F4A53449FC64599A946E771352A578C.description: Sign the main cities on a map.

48CCB3A0B83749038DC4B3E6BE371412.description: Ask who, what, when, where and why questions.

6986DFD889FC43AAB6DED378613AC777.description: Ask and answer simple questions about family, friends, activities or school.

2858F085A9524D9DA8DE1827FDD1BDEA.description: Exchange both formal and informal greetings.

55C9D348E3154408A7A906EC8F60EACB.description: Recognize a few variations on simple signs or phrases.

9B411738C5314A43AF3D28B036AA0645.description: Recognize some common weather expressions, locations or feelings.

BF6DBF60561D42E0A63F6FCD0762A0BB.description: Identify days of the week and time.

6A510E6F059044E894F9C281C1BE9DE8.description:
Identify similarities and differences in typical cultural products and practices to help understand perspectives in native and Deaf cultures, such as:
  • House design;
  • Support clubs, agencies and organizations;
  • Common table settings.

FB1227EB3317482E9C001A222072CF42.description: Sign simple directions or a line from a simple poem.

7DB8C22D206942CBA7D6408DE794C5A1.description: Sign name, age, phone number and email address.

B50829615B484184BD54B2EE78E266C6.description: Respond to yes, no, who, what, when and where questions.

4EE856D0E53F4105887EC943251BE4AB.description: Exchange greetings and introductions with a peer.

22196EC0C2D24F1CBCA58F4FDC005949.description: Follow a few simple classroom directions.

2376C1D529584397B7C5E1CC83446D30.description: Recognize a few short finger-spelled words or names.

10FF9D0121694B9593E66E5A7B769EA2.description: Understand a few numbers, food items or survival signs.

3AF0E52602264977846C4F4F86A0CB10.description:
Identify a few very familiar cultural products and practices in native and Deaf cultures, such as:
  • Assistive devices;
  • Landmarks;
  • Traditional and popular songs;
  • Greetings and leave-takings.

3D92EED4645A414B9EDB5CE1136ACADE.description: Recreate a scene from a myth or historical event.

689AACD97D55418F8CF0C58D5F83FF69.description: Create simple cultural products, such as tombstones or political graffiti.

73A9AD4DE3E94B52A75C385A3F65534A.description: Create a simple cultural skit or reenactment with a peer.

DFCCFED18F35400E8B201BAC8CCC4CCF.description: Create a Venn diagram with a peer comparing Roman and U.S. houses.

B488E15B69A64BECA87810186F687655.description: Use knowledge of structures and syntax to deepen understanding.

ED6A4EDC28AB48648FCC5CB7E52DE6BB.description: Identify the topic and a few details about events or people from history or literature.

2EEBA6AD89BF42178BC0F2066A2495EB.description: Identify the topic or basic facts or details from tombstones, mile markers, political graffiti or excerpts from texts or letters.

50583AE6794847CBAB04E1F785087922.description:
Identify similarities and differences in simple cultural products and practices to help understand perspectives in native and other cultures, such as:
  • Tombstones, political graffiti, mile markers;
  • Use and importance of Roman baths;
  • Influence of legendary and historical figures and events;
  • Views of non-Romans or non-Greeks.

2BBD3A3985B24D87B54169B271340FA2.description: Create a meme with a simple caption to describe oneself.

AA4A62BEB2D74282B31591D68F635AB3.description: Recite short phrases or simple lines from poems and rhymes.

F119DC3E12634348963C56B93AD61EAF.description: Share simple facts from a cultural reading or lesson.

00AD2ACDF4C741BAAE5A03AD44F3120B.description: Ask and answer simple questions related to the current topic or content.

DC6E99269459401EB8C15C24B1ACD30B.description: Use knowledge of language patterns or structures to deepen understanding.

9B4EE83712794593A4190F79EA313F19.description: Recognize all Roman numerals or Greek letters.

21D67EDF647B4B20B0C7C9E638BDA4DF.description: Understand simple phrases describing a historical character.

717C768FFDEF4B7BA4CA7ABEE98D2452.description: Identify simple facts from a caption on a photo.

8536206E4C2C45B8BC6222540CDD5718.description:
Identify similarities and differences between typical cultural products and practices to help understand perspectives in native and other cultures, such as:
  • Celebrating holidays;
  • Manner of dress;
  • Dining posture;
  • Types and rooms of Roman or Greek houses;
  • Importance of mythology;
  • War and empire.

6DDBB5A8DA2E4685919A9DFC22537047.description: Name or label familiar people, places, things or events.

8E3B40C1137F4CFB92825A4CCC5EFA12.description: Participate in a reenactment of a Roman or Greek ceremony.

E09F95A54BEE4E9A943309CD91F37175.description: Respond to simple questions about familiar topics, such as family, education or foods.

6C4270B2BF114ADD91376BA64E72AC3B.description: Use knowledge of language patterns or structures to deepen understanding.

E6E0091FC8874896943A299C73C380D2.description: Connect simple words, phrases, Roman numerals or Greek letters to their meaning or image.

4BFE1D0CF398418B9F41E500366E8451.description: Identify a few holidays and their modern equivalent, such as Saturnalia or Lupercalia.

A71FD7C4DB004C36AFAF8180F00541F0.description:
Identify a few very familiar cultural products and practices in native and other cultures, such as:
  • Traditional foods;
  • Holidays;
  • Clothing;
  • Roman numerals or Greek alphabet;
  • Family;
  • Education;
  • Human beings and the gods;
  • Roman values.

F895DFC74786433BB3120A8104CA05E1.description:
Identify similarities and differences between typical cultural products and practices to help understand perspectives in native and other cultures, such as:
  • Products and practices related to content in other classes;
  • Monuments, architecture;
  • Currency, metric conversion;
  • Sports, popular events;
  • Meals, grocery shopping
  • Give simple information related to content taught in other classes using sentences or graphic organizers.
  • Create a schedule for school, after school activities or a school project timeline.
  • Create a birthday, holiday or to-do list.
  • Give a short description about a favorite character in a story, book, movie or TV show.
  • Describe favorite activities during the school week, on weekends or during vacations.
  • Create a simple slogan or poster to advertise an event.

A56AF5E42F8A4E39AC14D0538FD09314.description: Present information using mostly simple sentences and transitions.

E66D40209B3C4B7482371E200C938E29.description:
Identify similarities and differences between typical products and practices in native and other cultures, such as:
  • Products and practices related to content in other classes;
  • Food, mealtimes;
  • Decorations, how people celebrate;
  • Invitations, special occasions;
  • Rooms in a house, house design;
  • Famous artists, art styles;
  • School subjects, school schedules.
  • Write or tell simple information related to content taught in other classes using a few simple sentences or graphic organizer.
  • Recite simple poems, songs, chants or rhymes.
  • Use courtesy phrases with peers when playing a game or on the playground.
  • Name family members and friends, their ages, relationship and what they like to do.
  • Use appropriate word order and punctuation when writing the date, time, address or phone number.
  • Caption photos of familiar people, places, things or events.
  • Tell very simple information from a story.

FB9D5D362508467A9895324CEE88905F.description: Present information using a mixture of practiced and familiar words, phrases and simple sentences.

DE60C435D9FA4DA793B343AF8027DC1F.description:
Identify a few very familiar cultural products and practices in native and other cultures, such as:
  • Traditional foods, celebrating holidays;
  • School supplies, addressing teachers;
  • Free-time activities, what to wear;
  • Calendar, telling the date;
  • Greeting friends and adults;
  • Flags and flag colors;
  • Children's songs and accompanying actions.
  • Name or write traditional and non-traditional letters, numbers or simple words that are similar to content taught in other classes.
  • Tell favorite places to eat, visit, vacation or play.
  • Tell favorite or preferred foods from pictures on a menu or restaurant website.
  • Name or label very familiar people, places or things in images, classroom or school.
  • Name or label preferences based on images of activities, teams, superheroes or animals.
  • Name or label places on a map or pictures of classmates or family members.
  • Count or write numbers from 1-10.
  • Copy simple phrases such as birthday or holiday greetings.

CE6FDFF13828415AB29CBD3AE5BB26DF.description: Present information using practiced or familiar words and phrases, with the help of gestures or visuals.

372EACE95DDD410F84727E97B08ADFFF.description: Use digital and cultural resources appropriately.

C2EFB5B23F1A48D4930AE0654FB0CBDB.description: Maintain audience interest via content, creativity, emotion, humor, technology or visuals.

BFC8EB73FF9648FB9B5DF230B4779F99.description: Communicate with attention to pronunciation, spelling, punctuation, hand shapes or signing parameters.

22CC20A2DED349AC87C776D9268D3FC3.description: Organize information in a logical sequence, with topic sentence, simple details and conclusion, and support with gestures, visuals or additional language as needed.

80C350425FD54E919BC1C4213835797D.description: Use familiar content, structures and syntax that are relevant to the topic and authentic resources as needed.

3809B45A13784CBF983E056440CF1A25.description: Use presentational skills to communicate effectively.

B4139A251BD74EFB996E2AFB582B5571.description: Use digital and cultural resources appropriately.

BD1214D09B484864A2F57E1BF5150A4B.description: Maintain audience interest via gestures, creativity, emotion, humor, technology or visuals.

C10068D89C4F4EB8874C8651CEAC31B7.description: Communicate with awareness of pronunciation, spelling, punctuation, hand shapes or signing parameters.

43E2E458A5BC41F1B603B6153FDB47FF.description: Organize simple information in a logical sequence and support with gestures or visuals.

E27BBA830EF9416CBC7C77CB3CD93ABC.description: Use familiar vocabulary and structures that are relevant to the topic and very simple authentic resources as needed.

1C62F58EF5ED4AA996EBBC02EA2C6A7A.description: Use presentational skills to communicate effectively.

E6B89E4817AD41EC81B81A3722169432.description: Use digital and cultural resources appropriately.

8D3067D97D484FF58ED8F14FB97C1A91.description: Maintain audience interest via gestures, creativity, emotion, technology or visuals.

A5DF0B7E11994A94911F195DFBDF952D.description: Communicate with emerging awareness of pronunciation, spelling, punctuation, hand shapes or signing parameters.

D0D3E3A7D609480C9039C02952CA6D98.description: Organize very simple information in a logical sequence and support with gestures or visuals.

20150881BB844345A4C19E3B82DAD581.description: Use familiar vocabulary and structures that are relevant to the topic and very simple authentic resources as needed.

13556DF35C3C4D0F812F46AAFEA1A6CB.description: Use presentational skills to communicate effectively.

8D9C8F43F59B4D1B997E4604DBE32E61.description: Express preferences on familiar and everyday topics or topics of interest from native and other cultures.

F26AE016B3F5459C965930DBADB003F4.description: Provide details about personal life, interests and activities.

14DAAEE2DA164BF68EF69CBAE98E91AC.description: Give simple descriptions of familiar and everyday topics.

2E3B07E763334854B86278A57681E668.description: Present in very familiar situations using practiced or learned language and behaviors.

63A55A14887B469FB6C64F09ED1F2F73.description: Identify similarities and differences between typical products and practices related to everyday life to help understand perspectives of native and other cultures.

110D1AA0F0EF430CAD15E4BDAC738CA7.description: Present information using mostly simple sentences and transitions.

C8155572C34F40AC9DBD0C0BAE72541B.description: Express likes and dislikes about familiar topics from native and other cultures.

ED7CBDC403B744A2A777C95067B379D8.description: Provide simple details about self, interests and activities.

D50CB92278B8402FB33E2ED5C96DB527.description: Give simple information about very familiar topics.

8B759C6DCDD1403E9334709974462BB6.description: Present in very familiar intercultural situations using practiced or learned language and behaviors.

D0ABEA525B86401885D7AFC4E32DD06D.description: Identify typical products and practices related to familiar, everyday life in native and other cultures.

629DCB1CE0B748B1BB7FA9407AE4C001.description: Present information using a mixture of practiced and familiar words, phrases and simple sentences.

476A1B92773B432F9E6616B8298AA804.description: Express likes and dislikes about very familiar topics from native and other cultures.

5B124C1825DF4676A1B6B963B993795B.description: Provide very basic details about self.

BDF4DAEED1594ED486BE5767CE5EB32D.description: Name very familiar people, places and objects.

5B2BF8637E9E478E95104DEC930E54C7.description: Present in very familiar intercultural situations using memorized or practiced language and behaviors.

0F3592B17E9E49B8B87A20A11F461CC6.description: Identify a few typical products and practices related to familiar, everyday life in native and other cultures.

3781524D71CE475E9CE3FBA75DF6CF92.description: Present information using practiced or familiar words and phrases with the help of gestures or visuals.

136E72F7FAD14E5C965180028DD81E92.description:
Identify similarities and differences between typical cultural products and practices to help understand perspectives in native and other cultures, such as:
  • Products and practices related to content in other classes;
  • Monuments, architecture;
  • Currency, metric conversion;
  • Sports, popular events;
  • Meals, grocery shopping
  • Exchange simple information related to content taught in other classes.
  • Talk with friends about what to wear to various events.
  • Ask and answer simple questions about information in a chart, diagram or infographic.
  • Create a Venn diagram with a peer comparing two topics in a classroom lesson.
  • Exchange simple opinions with peers about food, actors, movies, books, video games or other areas of interest.
  • Work with a peer to create a simple skit.

22C84DE2243846D19C9CD6D426A3376D.description: Communicate with others by asking and answering practiced and some original questions using simple sentences most of the time.

6E94D768933F4DBA9C072101F8985E40.description:
Identify similarities and differences between typical products and practices in native and other cultures, such as:
  • Products and practices related to content in other classes;
  • Food, mealtimes;
  • Decorations, how people celebrate;
  • Invitations, special occasions;
  • Rooms in a house, house design;
  • Famous artists, art styles;
  • School subjects, school schedules.
  • Ask and answer simple questions related to content taught in other classes.
  • Ask and answer simple questions such as name, age, address, phone number and social media handle.
  • Ask and answer simple questions about preferences in colors, sports teams, music, movies, singers or actors.
  • Ask and answer simple questions about hobbies, food, pets, school subjects, homework, technology, family or friends.
  • Express needs such as hungry or cold and ask others.
  • Ask and answer simple math problems or spelling words.

0492EEA346EA4531928F1303958F4EBD.description: Communicate with others by asking and answering a few practiced questions using words, phrases and simple sentences.

F396DB1CE04C4AF6B8E78BA60BA1BA15.description:
Identify a few very familiar cultural products and practices in native and other cultures, such as:
  • Traditional foods, celebrating holidays;
  • School supplies, addressing teachers;
  • Free time activities, what to wear;
  • Calendar, telling the date;
  • Greeting friends and adults;
  • Flags and flag colors;
  • Children's songs and accompanying actions.
  • Respond to simple questions related to content taught in other classes.
  • Greet, say goodbye to peers or adults.
  • Respond to simple questions such as name, age, address and phone number.
  • Respond to simple questions about family, friends, pets or activities.
  • Respond to simple questions such as favorite color, team, food or animal.
  • Respond to a simple math problem, such as how many pennies are in a nickel or math computations.
  • Exchange simple well-wishes on birthdays or holidays.
  • Volunteer when the teacher asks for help.

FD9FEE0C08E1487080B6D0E21BB12288.description: Communicate with others by answering a few practiced questions with words and phrases and the help of visuals or gestures.

50E36952A59540C285E2E0949E5C0F63.description: Use digital and cultural resources appropriately.

72CC77176DD14D39821894AD88C47360.description: Infer meaning of unfamiliar language from gestures, facial and body expressions, context clues or topic of conversation.

5701620719354395A5D54FBB320C2010.description: Increase comprehensibility and clarify information using word substitution, rephrasing, circumlocution or attention to pronunciation, tone or pitch.

243255DFB867433EA12A368E6827F7F6.description: Use simple interrogatives, rejoinders interjections, requests for clarification or transition words.

B6513FE968A9427ABBFE20CB431C18A5.description: Use culturally appropriate and relevant language and rehearsed or learned behaviors to communicate, react and show interest.

CDFF6E80B72B4DE1905574389C92D80F.description: Use interpersonal skills to interact, negotiate meaning and communicate effectively.

DD0EBDC01E4245A1AEA53C9F4EDD53E4.description: Use digital and cultural resources appropriately.

5D86F1DE27FF4733B8894415E85535C5.description: Infer meaning of unfamiliar language from gestures, facial and body expressions or context clues during simple interactions.

8810867125A04F6F9A05BE71F114246B.description: Increase comprehensibility using gestures, hand shapes, facial expressions, repetition or word substitution.

0102D0159CDB4943A5482945EE28FD5D.description: Use very simple verbal and nonverbal interrogatives, rejoinders, interjections or requests for clarification.

D5AE7A0E750E4BEB8759BD5D04BDE1AB.description: Use familiar, relevant vocabulary and structures and rehearsed or imitated cultural behaviors to communicate, react and show interest.

1DF51D4B88DB414FB6F21A653DE9CBF2.description: Use interpersonal skills to interact, negotiate meaning and communicate effectively.

4ECE934EEFEA4A27A6069A340A152AD5.description: Use digital and cultural resources appropriately.

3D9993493F91497589BD021805B0F8F5.description: Infer meaning of unfamiliar language from gestures, facial and body expressions or context clues during simple interactions.

7D1BA739B88C4909920FB48F904DCD85.description: Increase comprehensibility using gestures, hand shapes, facial expressions or repetition.

3FE722F197C04A2880E884A3842C9FF1.description: Use a few very simple verbal or nonverbal rejoinders or interjections.

E0A6E03A8B80460892B7B4162076B825.description: Use familiar, relevant vocabulary or structures and rehearsed or imitated cultural behaviors to communicate, react and show interest.

357F4434BA19425B98729CA40BCCAFD3.description: Use interpersonal skills to interact and communicate effectively.

6066A1E5E0D148D3A13F69FF53733A67.description: Express, ask about, and react to simple preferences, feelings or opinions on familiar topics.

524C59D58CA643279AE65DC4A081B40D.description: Interact with others to meet basic needs in familiar and everyday situations.

9B8C8B6552654A44A95317D5297EAB25.description: Request and share information on familiar and everyday topics.

5FF372ED7F35426EAFB12BBC5DDD9811.description: Interact in familiar, everyday intercultural situations using practiced language and behaviors, and show cultural awareness by recognizing culturally inappropriate behaviors.

A13C64F476ED4FEF83E96F396211F1CB.description: Identify products and practices related to everyday life to help understand perspectives of native and other cultures.

BC7E4F09A50E4191B96D606E189D53CF.description: Communicate with others by asking and answering practiced and some original questions using simple sentences most of the time.

90E1ACDB557C4E69A91B5999C2EAECA8.description: Express basic preferences or feelings and react to those of others.

5D4DD382D472408B8C5ECDB0362A49B0.description: Express basic needs in familiar or everyday situations.

0BF93FF27D7547BC872065553BE090F5.description: Request and share simple information on familiar or everyday topics.

903C10051FA842D3B9E9517ADEFF9C8C.description: Interact in very familiar intercultural situations using practiced language and behaviors and show cultural awareness by recognizing a few culturally inappropriate behaviors.

3A0034B5AEC14AC3B2EC2C5390E3D84D.description: Identify typical products and practices related to familiar, everyday life in native and other cultures.

08401BF74A674E5AB1BAE8D0336D4AD6.description: Communicate with others by asking and answering a few practiced questions using words, phrases and simple sentences.

7EF693C860B44EC5A4454D304A8F7E10.description: Express a few basic preferences or feelings.

30185F8FC7954C8A8953284F512F106B.description: Express a few basic personal needs in very familiar situations.

B0A2089D974F4647A172496A03693E66.description: Provide basic information on very familiar topics.

AA23F06B164E4413A523130A8D357469.description: Interact in very familiar intercultural situations using practiced language and behaviors.

BC910707FFE04D04B0CEAC7AF6CD3050.description: Identify a few typical products and practices related to familiar, everyday life in native and other cultures.

C6000A199C044B05A7FFF40D98DF7563.description: Communicate with others by answering a few practiced questions with words and phrases and the help of visuals or gestures.

99732A0826CE401DB113FC11AD5EF2F9.description:
Identify similarities and differences between typical cultural products and practices to help understand perspectives in native and other cultures, such as:
  • Products and practices related to content in other classes;
  • Monuments, architecture;
  • Currency, metric conversion;
  • Sports, popular events;
  • Meals, grocery shopping.
  • Understand words, phrases or information related to content taught in other classes.
  • Draw images as they are described.
  • Follow simple steps to create an object, play a game, solve a puzzle or follow a scavenger hunt.
  • Understand simple messages on greeting cards.
  • Identify a few product details from an ad or commercial.
  • Identify a few events in a cartoon, TV show or movie clip.
  • Identify information in a simple diagram or infographic.

1259585BF7494D62AB7EA89380BBA2CB.description: Identify the topic and basic related information from simple sentences.

A94B2A7EB4384744823C188A0857279A.description:
Identify similarities and differences between typical products and practices in native and other cultures, such as:
  • Products and practices related to content in other classes;
  • Food, mealtimes;
  • Decorations, how people celebrate;
  • Invitations, special occasions;
  • Rooms in a house, house design;
  • Famous artists, art styles;
  • School subjects, school schedules.
  • Recognize words, phrases or simple facts related to content taught in other classes.
  • Recognize repeated words, taglines or short quotes from jingles, ads, movies, songs, rhymes, chants or poems.
  • Identify simple phrases describing physical or personality traits of a story, cartoon or movie character.
  • Follow classroom instructions, routines and schedules.
  • Identify simple information from words and symbols in a weather forecast, science experiment or math problem.

9566CF3EA74C4EDE8D6ADE46B8B96C1D.description: Identify basic facts from practiced or familiar words and phrases supported by visuals, gestures and facial expressions.

CB0AC835C6AB4AB3874BA6120DA80106.description:
Identify a few very familiar cultural products and practices in native and other cultures, such as:
  • Traditional foods, celebrating holidays;
  • School supplies, addressing teachers;
  • Free-time activities, what to wear;
  • Calendar, telling the date;
  • Greeting friends and adults;
  • Flags and flag colors;
  • Children's songs and accompanying actions.
  • Recognize or draw traditional and nontraditional letters, numbers or shapes that are similar to content from other classes.
  • Recognize a few individual words in children's songs, simple rhymes, poems, chants or book titles.
  • Recognize or draw a few individual words from posters or labeled objects inside the classroom.
  • Match a letter, character, word or color to an image.
  • Follow simple classroom instructions or routines.
  • Recognize a character's name in a story or fairy tale.

6DCE920A1DAE42CFBF078751BE8DB646.description: Identify practiced or familiar words and phrases supported by visuals, gestures and facial expressions.

D8523923A66A45BDB0558A8B4C0424BD.description: Use digital and cultural resources appropriately.

4C2E909FBE684C8892659A5C74F8EDB9.description: Make simple text-to-text connections using information from previous texts.

C37DF7BED1CB420ABF3B186821896E25.description: Use a mixture of literal and inferential self-questioning before, during and after engaging with texts, such as "What happened or what might happen next?"

042D77BAA8E94509B4F2B1A700485693.description: Use visual, aural and organizational features to identify the purpose of simple texts, such as announcements, instructions, fables or graphics.

005D464DEF1741D6AA80CECBF43D96AA.description: Recognize cognates and infer meaning of unfamiliar words or phrases using context clues and background knowledge.

5E0942F53EFF499F95FADBA440835426.description: Use literacy skills to comprehend authentic texts* that are spoken, written or signed.

280F1EBB2B4D43DDADE901972D88C10B.description: Use digital and cultural resources appropriately.

5769310A7BE64DF6B6A11BBA48A24375.description: Make personal connections to a text using background knowledge or experiences.

17A59E6CD7544C28BFEE1FA2CF717ED1.description: Use literal or factual self-questioning before, during and after engaging with texts, such as "What time, who is, why or how?"

D32FA429BD1B498FAE46BD33A8341D1B.description: Recognize visual, aural and organizational features to identify the purpose of simple texts, such as schedules, song refrains, simple poems or infographics.

B0EB39FB48354D1A9C0BFA5A99869BD8.description: Recognize non-traditional letters, accents, characters or tone marks, as well as cognates and words from context.
